recipes.name: Tomato and Mozzarella Salad
recipes.instructions: Slice the tomatoes and mozzarella. Arrange them on a plate alternately. Sprinkle with fresh basil. Season with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.

recipes.name: Spaghetti with Tomato Sauce
recipes.instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions. Meanwhile, sauté the garlic in olive oil. Add crushed tomatoes and simmer until tender. Add chopped basil and season to taste. Serve the sauce on cooked spaghetti with grated Parmesan.

recipes.name: Margherita Pizza
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 220°C. Roll out the pizza dough on a baking sheet. Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on the dough. Drizzle with olive oil and add basil leaves. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the crust is golden.

recipes.name: Chicken with Sun-Dried Tomatoes
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C. Place the chicken pieces in a baking dish. Add tomatoes, minced garlic, and thyme. Drizzle with olive oil and season to taste. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked.

recipes.name: Tomato Bruschetta
recipes.instructions: Slice the baguette and lightly toast it. Rub the slices with garlic for flavor. Arrange tomato slices on the toasted bread. Drizzle with olive oil and add chopped basil. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Tomato and Mustard Tart
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Roll out the shortcrust pastry in a tart tin. Spread a thin layer of mustard on the pastry base. Arrange tomato slices on the mustard. Crumble goat cheese over the tomatoes. Sprinkle with fresh thyme. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the crust is golden.

recipes.name: Gazpacho
recipes.instructions: Blend all the vegetables in a blender until smooth. Season with salt, pepper, red wine vinegar, and olive oil. Refrigerate for at least an hour before serving.

recipes.name: Greek Salad
recipes.instructions: Dice the tomatoes and cucumber. Slice the red onion. Add olives and crumbled feta. Season with salt, pepper, dried oregano, and olive oil. Mix well and serve.

recipes.name: Ratatouille
recipes.instructions: Slice or cube all the vegetables. Sauté onions in olive oil until tender. Add other vegetables and sauté until tender. Season with salt, pepper, garlic, and thyme. Serve hot or cold.

recipes.name: Pasta Puttanesca
recipes.instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Meanwhile, sauté anchovies, olives, and capers in olive oil. Add crushed tomatoes and simmer until tender. Season with salt, pepper, garlic, and red pepper flakes. Serve the sauce over cooked pasta.

recipes.name: Sun-Dried Tomato Quiche
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Roll out the puff pastry in a tart pan. Arrange sun-dried tomatoes on the pastry base. Crumble goat cheese over the tomatoes. Beat the eggs with cream, season with salt and pepper. Pour the mixture over the tart. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the filling is set.

recipes.name: Stuffed Tomatoes
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Cut the tops off the tomatoes and scoop out the insides. In a bowl, mix minced meat, chopped onion, garlic, and parsley. Fill the tomatoes with this mixture. Place the stuffed tomatoes in a baking dish. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until the meat is cooked.

recipes.name: Stuffed Tomatoes with Rice
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Cut the tops off the tomatoes and scoop out the insides. Cook the rice according to package instructions. In a skillet, sauté chopped onion and garlic until tender. Add cooked rice and chopped parsley. Fill the tomatoes with this mixture. Place the stuffed tomatoes in a baking dish. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the tomatoes are tender.

recipes.name: Caprese Bruschetta
recipes.instructions: Slice the ciabatta bread and lightly toast it. Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on the toasted bread. Drizzle with olive oil and add chopped basil. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Roasted Tomato Soup
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C. Cut the tomatoes in half and place them on a baking sheet. Add minced garlic and onion. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with thyme. Roast in the oven for 30-40 minutes. Transfer the roasted tomatoes to a saucepan with vegetable broth. Simmer for 10 minutes. Use an immersion blender to puree. Season to taste.

recipes.name: Sun-Dried Tomato Pasta Salad
recipes.instructions: Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Meanwhile, chop sun-dried tomatoes, spinach, and basil. Mix the cooked pasta with sun-dried tomatoes, spinach, and basil. Add crumbled feta cheese and season to taste. Serve cold.

recipes.name: Vegetable Tian
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Slice all the vegetables thinly. Layer the slices in a gratin dish, alternating between different vegetables. Sprinkle with fresh thyme. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 40-50 minutes or until the vegetables are tender and golden.

recipes.name: Tomato Couscous Salad
recipes.instructions: Prepare the couscous according to package instructions. Let it cool. Dice the tomatoes and cucumber. Chop mint and parsley. Mix all ingredients in a salad bowl. Season with salt, pepper, lemon juice, and olive oil. Serve chilled.

recipes.name: Avocado and Tomato Bruschetta
recipes.instructions: Slice the country bread and lightly toast it. Rub the slices with garlic for flavor. Arrange tomato and avocado slices on the toasted bread. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Marinara Sauce
recipes.instructions: In a saucepan, sauté onion and garlic in olive oil until tender. Add crushed tomatoes and simmer for 20-30 minutes. Add chopped basil and oregano. Season to taste. Use this sauce on pasta, pizzas, or other dishes.

recipes.name: Sautéed Potatoes
recipes.instructions: Peel and dice the potatoes. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the potato cubes and fry until golden and crispy. Season with salt and pepper.

recipes.name: Gratin Dauphinois
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Peel and thinly slice the potatoes. In a saucepan, heat the cream, milk, and minced garlic until the mixture is hot. Arrange the potato slices in a baking dish. Pour the cream mixture over the potatoes. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Bake for 45-60 minutes or until the top is golden and the potatoes are tender.

recipes.name: Homemade French Fries
recipes.instructions: Peel the potatoes and cut them into sticks. Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot over medium-high heat. Fry the potato sticks until they are golden and crispy. Drain them on paper towels and season with salt.

recipes.name: Mashed Potatoes
recipes.instructions: Peel and cut the potatoes into pieces. Cook them in boiling salted water until tender. Drain and mash them with a fork or potato masher. Add hot butter and milk gradually until you reach the desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper.

recipes.name: Spanish Tortilla
recipes.instructions: Peel and thinly slice the potatoes. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the potatoes and chopped onion. Cook until the potatoes are tender. Beat the eggs in a bowl and pour them over the potatoes. Season with salt. Cook until the eggs are set and the bottom is golden. Flip the tortilla and cook on the other side until golden.

recipes.name: Potato Leek Soup
recipes.instructions: Peel and dice the potatoes. Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat. Add chopped onion and minced garlic. Sauté until tender. Add potato cubes and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender. Use an immersion blender to puree. Add cream and season with salt and pepper.

recipes.name: Baked Potatoes
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C. Wash the potatoes and prick them with a fork. Bake for 45-60 minutes or until tender. Cut them open on top and press the sides to open them up. Top with butter, sour cream, grated cheese, and cooked bacon.

recipes.name: Potato Croquettes
recipes.instructions: Peel and dice the potatoes. Cook them in boiling salted water until tender. Drain and mash them with a fork. Add beaten eggs, chopped parsley, and salt. Shape croquettes from the mixture and roll them in breadcrumbs. Fry in hot oil until golden and crispy.

recipes.name: Garlic Sauteed Potatoes
recipes.instructions: Peel and dice the potatoes. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add potato cubes and cook until golden and crispy. Add minced garlic and chopped parsley. Season with salt and sauté for a few more minutes.

recipes.name: Shepherd's Pie
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Peel and chop the potatoes into pieces. Cook them in boiling salted water until tender. Drain and mash them with a fork. In a skillet, sauté chopped onion and minced garlic. Add ground beef and cook until browned. Place the meat in a baking dish. Cover with mashed potatoes and sprinkle with grated cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the top is golden.

recipes.name: Potato and Leek Soup
recipes.instructions: Peel and dice the potatoes. Clean and slice the leeks. Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat. Add the leeks and cook until tender. Add the potato cubes and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender. Use an immersion blender to puree. Add sour cream and season with salt and pepper. Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

recipes.name: Swiss Rösti
recipes.instructions: Grate the potatoes and onion. Press to remove excess moisture. Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the potato and onion mixture to the skillet. Spread evenly and press with a spatula. Cook until the bottom is golden and crispy. Flip and cook on the other side until golden and crispy. Season with salt and pepper before serving.

recipes.name: Provencal Potatoes
recipes.instructions: Peel and dice the potatoes. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the potato cubes and cook until golden and crispy. Add diced tomatoes, chopped onion, and minced garlic. Sprinkle with Herbes de Provence. Cook until the vegetables are tender. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Swedish Hasselback Potatoes
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C. Peel the potatoes but do not cut them all the way through. Place them on a cutting board and slice them thinly, being careful not to cut all the way through at the base. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add minced garlic and thyme. Arrange the potatoes in a baking dish. Pour the butter mixture over the potatoes and chicken broth into the dish. Bake for 45-60 minutes or until golden and tender.

recipes.name: Salmon and Potato Gratin
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Peel and thinly slice the potatoes. Cook the salmon in the oven or steam until cooked. Arrange a layer of potatoes in a baking dish. Add a layer of crumbled salmon. Repeat layers until all ingredients are used. In a saucepan, heat the cream and milk. Pour the mixture over the potatoes and salmon. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Bake for 45-60 minutes or until the top is golden and the potatoes are tender.

recipes.name: Cheese-Stuffed Potatoes
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C. Wash the potatoes and prick them with a fork. Bake for 45-60 minutes or until tender. Cut them open on top and press the sides to open them up. Mix grated cheddar cheese, cooked bacon, sour cream, and chopped chives. Top the potatoes with this mixture.

recipes.name: Herbed Potatoes
recipes.instructions: Peel and dice the potatoes. Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the potato cubes and cook until golden and crispy. Add minced garlic, chopped parsley, and thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Sauté until the herbs are fragrant.

recipes.name: Buttered Pasta
recipes.instructions: Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Drain and mix with butter. Season with salt to taste.

recipes.name: Vegetable Omelette
recipes.instructions: Beat eggs in a bowl. Add diced vegetables. Season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a skillet and pour in the mixture. Cook until the omelette is set.

recipes.name: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
recipes.instructions: Spread butter on one side of the bread. Place cheese between the two slices of bread (buttered side facing out). Grill in a skillet until the cheese is melted and the bread is golden.

recipes.name: Caesar Salad
recipes.instructions: Cut lettuce and chicken into pieces. Add croutons and parmesan. Season with Caesar dressing and mix.

recipes.name: Roasted Potatoes
recipes.instructions: Cut potatoes into wedges. Mix with olive oil, salt, pepper, and herbs de Provence. Spread on a baking sheet and roast in the oven until golden brown.

recipes.name: Vegetable Rice
recipes.instructions: Cook rice according to package instructions. Meanwhile, sauté vegetables in oil until tender. Mix vegetables with cooked rice. Season with salt and pepper.

recipes.name: Homemade Pizza
ingredients: Choice of toppings (ham, mushrooms, peppers, olives)
recipes.instructions: Spread pizza dough on a baking sheet. Cover with tomato sauce, add cheese, and your choice of toppings. Bake according to dough package instructions.

recipes.name: Vegetable Soup
recipes.instructions: Cut vegetables into chunks. Cook in vegetable broth until tender. Season with salt, pepper, and fresh herbs.

recipes.name: Roast Chicken
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven. Season the chicken with salt, pepper, and herbs de Provence. Brush with olive oil. Roast in the oven until golden brown and cooked through.

recipes.name: Tacos
recipes.instructions: Cook ground beef in a skillet. Heat tortillas. Fill each tortilla with beef, beans, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and salsa sauce.
